We love the game. We usually use it using Steam Remote Play but there are some things which could be VERY improved:

.) Glitches where you are stuck in the wall (very rarely)
.) After you released your shot, in party mode you can e.g. double jump etc. For some reason, sometimes the game doesn't give you time to use these abiltites because it shows the next player even though the ball is still rolling. VERY UNFAIR AND ANNOYING!
.) Every user can use their inputs in other players turns using steam remote play (just be careful)

If they would fix these bugs this game would be very amazing, but the 2nd point always triggers us so much at some point that we don't want to play it anymore.

Golf With Your Friends is an engaging and entertaining game that brings the classic sport of golf to the virtual world. This game offers a unique and enjoyable multiplayer experience, allowing you to compete against your friends or other players from around the world. With its intuitive controls and realistic physics, Golf With Your Friends provides a realistic golfing experience while adding a fun and lighthearted twist to the gameplay. Step onto the virtual green with Golf With Your Friends, a game that combines the thrill of golf with the excitement of multiplayer competition. Whether you're a seasoned golfer or new to the sport, this game offers a delightful experience for players of all skill levels. The game features a variety of imaginative and challenging courses, each with its own set of obstacles and hazards. From towering castles to vibrant candy-themed landscapes, Golf With Your Friends takes you on a journey through visually stunning and creatively designed environments. Golf With Your Friends is more than just a game; it's an opportunity to connect and have fun with your friends. With its multiplayer mode, you can invite your buddies to join you in a friendly round of golf, or even compete against players from all over the world. The game also offers customization options, allowing you to personalize your golf ball and choose from a range of quirky and amusing power-ups. Whether you're aiming for a hole-in-one or trying to outsmart your opponents, Golf With Your Friends guarantees hours of laughter and enjoyment. So grab your virtual golf clubs and get ready to tee off in this exciting and addictive game. Golf With Your Friends is an incredibly amazing game that allows you to have a great time with your buddies. The game is designed to be easy to play and understand, making it perfect for anyone, including 8th graders. You can enjoy the game on your computer or gaming console, and it offers various exciting courses to explore. The active voice in the game's instructions and gameplay keeps you engaged and focused. Overall, Golf With Your Friends is a fantastic choice for a fun and entertaining gaming experience with your pals.

Fun game to play with friends.

It's simple but effective. You play golf with your friends, hence the name. It's mini golf-based maps, and you go around trying to get the lowest score. It is fun to find new maps people have created, and challenging fellow golfers at random, and challenge friends. If you play alone, though, this game will be pretty sad, so have friends. That's all I can say about Golf With Your Friends. If you want to have a fun time putting go for it, but you might need an extra pair of pants because you might get a hole in one. ;)

The best mini-golf game out there as far as I know and is a fun chill-out game to play with friends, but there are quirks with the physics that will make occasionally make you tug your hair, so just do your research and keep that in mind.

However, the cosmetics are fixed (as mentioned in the comments) and I think I was a little harsh here. I enjoy playing the game because it's with friends, even if it's the same courses again. I did notice there's also some course DLC now (though some of it is a bit pricey).

I'll update my review of this game since it has been many years. I take all negativity from my last review away. This is a fun game, it has developed to a point that it is hard to resist. It's a fun side game and a lot of fun with friends. There is a crap ton of courses to choose from and they all have lots of challenges. It's cool that you can modify your game to allow jumping and contact with other balls and adjust pretty much anything for your round of play. Highly recommend this game to play on your own or with friends. Suggest you stay away playing on pubs as there are many who know all the holes-in-one ways..and yes, there are griefers who will purposely hit your ball (if physical contact is on) just to screw you up or piss you off. Again can be avoided playing with friends or just finding another game or hosting yourself your own little game.

Again, highly recommend it, it's a lot of fun and lots and lots of courses to choose from!

Updated 12/2023
We just tried to play this on LOCAL multi-player, but it will not accept 2 or 4 controllers, whichever controller starts the game, it will only use that 1 controller, this must have been broken on the last update,. so pi55ed off with Team 17 for not sorting this game, why not just copy the system from Zen's infinite Mini Golf, the controllers and avatars in that are perfect, shame the game is screwed, we use to love that too! 


Just played this for the first time with Remote Play Together - we played the 1st course without any issues, great fun and lovely graphics.
We then played the Worms course, OMG it's full of bugs guys - the ball lands out of bounds, it stays there, making you lose that hole. 
The views on the ball are shocking, it was ok to hole 15 then it was shocking, like the camera was sat on the ball, impossible to see where you aiming/shooting and the clipping on the ball was terrible, like the camera going in the ball. 

During playback, all players can take control of the ball, this needs to be isolated to each player like Infinite Mini Golf, otherwise another player could sabotage your go, either on purpose or by accident.
I have been told by Team 17 this is down to Remote Play Together, I will try on I.M.G. later and see if the same issues arises as we know that does not happen in local multiplayer normally :) 

Even though the option to ALWAYS SHOW FLAG is ON, the flag was not always shown, on the larger courses on Worms Levels this made it total guess work to know where to aim :/ 

It did not always show where the other players ball was on the course.

It is V1 so hopefully this will be fixed very soon, but I bought this game in Alpha and got refunded due to the amount of bugs, so very surprised to see it hit retail and still be buggy - Luckily Team 17 are an awesome bunch and I have faith in them to fix this game :) 


I will say I recommend this game as it has massive potential, we play I.M.G. every Thursday but this could be our new go to Golf game if the bugs are fixed :)

--------------------------UPDATED -------------
After revisiting the game after several months, I've just posted this - read it before you buy it! 

Issues on Local OFFLINE Mode
This week my partner and I have had another go at this game, but still inundated by bugs that are infuriating.

Firstly, the players turn ends prematurely, so we cannot see where we are ending up on our go. We just played the level Space Station. and on Hole 17 I think it was, neither of us got the chance to steer in the water as it returned to the next player despite us not finishing our go, this meant we both got stuck and could not possibly get to the hole. On the same course my partner went out of bounds and her ball did not respawn, so she just had to waste her go.

The controllers still control the other players go, something I reported when I first got this game which was ages ago.

Player 1 always goes first, it should be whom ever won the hole goes first!

No RESTART HOLE option, much needed for when it glitches and leaves a player off the course :/

--------------- UPDATE ----------
Played quite a few courses now locally with family, the go ends prematurely on all levels - just now on Hole 18, I got the ball in the hole but my go and ended so and it came up that I had run out of shots - pretty crap considering I got in the hole! This needs fixing urgently!

Also, aside from the issue that all controllers work all of the time, the game remembers the last players camera angle, not each players, this could do with fixing too.

If you want to see how this should work then play Infinite Mini Golf, this game has the turn system perfect.

It would also be much better if players could have names and it remembered the settings for each Player instead of having to change the colours etc every single time we play.

"This game is one of my favorite games on Steam due to the current build and what I have already seen happen. This game outshines all similar golf games i've seen on Steam; for example, I have really enjoyed playing rounds of golf where we have been acorns, cones, even Christmas ornaments causing some insane and funny rounds. What changed between?
A couple maps got added so with the base game I do kinda recommend it as they haven't touched it and I still might play it with friends but that said I lost all respect for this game and the devs when I saw this get marked up 300% and 250% respectively to where with the 50% off for the 2023 christmas sale had 2 maps ALREADY RELEASED to where the 18 was "let's add $1.50" and the 9 hole one was "let's take off just .50 cents" This change might have happened a lot sooner than around christmas but after the main date but still why I stopped recommending this game is how the devs just seem very greedy and rather than trying to make it better just be effectively doing "Let's just use inflation explain how we're trying to further line our pockets by raising the price on DLC that was barely worth the original price if that".
Mark my words though devs if you are reading this and thinking "Oh raising the price of the game is a good idea" you better have a lot better reason for increasing the price of the base game more than "Inflation" and if you don't or give no reason at all I will never play this game or any other game from you again no matter what.

tl;dr good base game and great community but your fair warning is these devs have gotten a lot greedier over the years hence why I no longer recommend what was at one point one of my favorite games.

The Armenian genocide was the systematic destruction of the Armenian people and identity in the Ottoman Empire during World War I. Spearheaded by the ruling Committee of Union and Progress (CUP), it was implemented primarily through the mass murder of around one million Armenians during death marches to the Syrian Desert and the forced Islamization of others, primarily women and children.

Before World War I, Armenians occupied a somewhat protected, but subordinate, place in Ottoman society. Large-scale massacres of Armenians had occurred in the 1890s and 1909. The Ottoman Empire suffered a series of military defeats and territorial losses—especially during the 1912–1913 Balkan Wars—leading to fear among CUP leaders that the Armenians would seek independence. During their invasion of Russian and Persian territory in 1914, Ottoman paramilitaries massacred local Armenians. Ottoman leaders took isolated instances of Armenian resistance as evidence of a widespread rebellion, though no such rebellion existed. Mass deportation was intended to permanently forestall the possibility of Armenian autonomy or independence.

On 24 April 1915, the Ottoman authorities arrested and deported hundreds of Armenian intellectuals and leaders from Constantinople. At the orders of Talaat Pasha, an estimated 800,000 to 1.2 million Armenians were sent on death marches to the Syrian Desert in 1915 and 1916. Driven forward by paramilitary escorts, the deportees were deprived of food and water and subjected to robbery, rape, and massacres. In the Syrian Desert, the survivors were dispersed into concentration camps. In 1916, another wave of massacres was ordered, leaving about 200,000 deportees alive by the end of the year. Around 100,000 to 200,000 Armenian women and children were forcibly converted to Islam and integrated into Muslim households. Massacres and ethnic cleansing of Armenian survivors continued through the Turkish War of Independence after World War I, carried out by Turkish nationalists.

This genocide put an end to more than two thousand years of Armenian civilization in eastern Anatolia. Together with the mass murder and expulsion of Assyrian/Syriac and Greek Orthodox Christians, it enabled the creation of an ethnonationalist Turkish state, the Republic of Turkey. The Turkish government maintains that the deportation of Armenians was a legitimate action that cannot be described as genocide. As of 2023, 34 countries have recognized the events as genocide, concurring with the academic consensus.

[h1] Golf With Your Friends: A Whimsical Golfing Odyssey [/h1]

Introduction:

Why have friends if not to play golf... with your friends? Enter the zany world of "Golf With Your Friends," a multiplayer mini-golf extravaganza where nothing is out of bounds, and chaos is par for the course. Whether you're teeing off against friends or challenging strangers, this game promises fast-paced, exciting mini-golf for up to 12 players.

Gameplay:

The heart of "Golf With Your Friends" lies in its multiplayer madness. Up to 12 players can simultaneously engage in mini-golf, making every hole a chaotic battleground of skill and strategy. The themed courses add an extra layer of excitement, with unique mechanics and challenges. From pirate adventures to worm warfare, each course offers a distinctive experience that keeps the game fresh and engaging.

Powerups:

What sets this golfing experience apart is the inclusion of powerups. Drive a wedge between your friends by trapping their ball in honey, freezing it, or even turning it into a cube. These powerups add a delightful layer of strategy and mischief, turning a simple golf game into a hilarious competition where anything goes.

Game Modes:

"Golf With Your Friends" doesn't stop at traditional mini-golf. It offers three diverse game modes to keep players entertained. Tee off in classic mini-golf, aim for pars in hoops, or swap the hole for a goal in hockey. Each mode brings its own set of challenges, ensuring that every round feels fresh and exciting.

Level Editor:

Unleash your creativity with the level editor, allowing you to putt your own spin on the game. Create, share, and play custom courses, adding a limitless dimension to the gaming experience. The community-driven content ensures that there's always something new to explore and conquer.

Customizations:

Express your style on the fairway with a range of unlockable hats, skins, and trails for your ball. Whether you turn the fairway into a runway or choose a more whimsical approach, the customization options add a personal touch to your golfing adventures.

Player Experiences:

1. Rage-Inducing Fun:

"Golf With Your Friends" is a rage-inducing golf game that thrives on absurdity. From playing with unconventional shapes to altering gravity, the game's sheer stupidity becomes its greatest asset, offering a good kind of frustration that keeps players hooked.

2. Challenging Yet Simple:

The game strikes a balance between challenge and simplicity. While it can be frustrating at times, especially with friends, the learning curve is manageable. Once you get the hang of it, "Golf With Your Friends" transforms into a delightful way to pass the time.

3. Multiplayer Dynamics:

The game truly shines in a multiplayer setting. Playing with friends introduces a dynamic that elevates the experience, turning each round into a hilarious and competitive affair. Collaborate, sabotage, and revel in the chaos as you navigate the whimsical courses together.

Conclusion:

"Golf With Your Friends" is more than just a golf game; it's a whimsical journey into multiplayer mayhem. With its clever blend of challenging gameplay, diverse game modes, and creative level editor, it stands out as a unique and entertaining addition to the mini-golf genre. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or a casual player, the game's charm lies in its ability to turn a simple concept into a riotous and enjoyable experience. For those seeking a lighthearted and laughter-filled gaming session, "Golf With Your Friends" is a hole-in-one. So, grab your clubs, gather your friends, and tee off into the fantastical world of mini-golf shenanigans.

If you have friends who want you to play this with them, then its worth it (if you don't value your sanity). if you don't have friends then this is really has no reason to be in your library.

Even so, this game has many frustrating parts.
Biggest issue i have is the par system, doing the course as intended you would have to do it near perfect to get par. which means you really have to "cheat" and really go wild to get better scores, and lets not mention pure luck
The real big issue is the jumping, many a time i would click jump and there would be a significant delay, i keenly noticed this while going fast, and its just frustrating because its hard to do fancy tricks when there is a delay.
As well as "recently" (I don't know when but it wasn't this way the last time i played) sometimes when you bounce out of bounds and then back in, you still get reset, even though you ended up back on the green. but not all times, and so that just adds to my frustration

Edit: November 27th 2023
I made the mistake of playing this game again, holy hell its still terrible. I played the Egypt(?) styled map, the hole with the mound literally had me hitting invisible barriers at the edge of the bowl on the top of the mound. so instead of going into the bowl and hole, I instead would roll back down to the bottom of the hole.

And STILL you can barely go off the edge, end up on the green and get reset, like the last hole I did I bounced in the water, landed on the green, was there for a second or 2 and then as I prepared to line up the next shot I was reset back to where I shot from.

This game just is not fun.

I have mixed feelings here. 

I like the putting controls. It's basically an aiming arrow and you push your mouse forward or backward depending on how hard you want to hit the ball; you don't have to make a swing motion. Very nice.

What I don't like is that sometimes you literally can't see where the end of the course is. The flag/hole is either obscured or in some crazy direction you wouldn't think to look (even under you). You can free look around the course for a few seconds, but after that, you're blocked on you have to take your shot. You will unfortunately be able to see areas that you've already played, or will play, and this confuses you as to whether that area is part of the hole that you're on. 

Meh - I'll say 6 out of 10.

This game is infinitely more fun with friends playing. I was having a whole lot more fun streaming this game with friends and viewers than when I was sat alone trying to polish off the last couple of achievements. I think there could be more optimization for the workshop, but that's not the core game anyways. I think it's a good game for what it is, and I'd reccomend picking it up if you don't have it already. Just make sure you know someone that has the game or is willing to buy it to play with you, because that's what makes this game its most fun.

Side-note, that 10k put achievement is legitimately the longest grind ever. Even if you can rack up a 100 put game going quickly, you would need to play through 100 games before getting the achievement. In my experience, I could get through a map after about 10 minutes, which means that this achievement alone takes anywhere from 16 to 17 hours going quickly. A bit brutal, to say the least.

EDIT: They devs are now locking achievements behind playing courses that are paid DLC. You can technically get them by playing in public lobbies that have people who have bought them, but good luck getting below par on a one off game. Fun casually, absolute nightmare for people looking to 100% the game.

A solid fun mini golfing game. Reminds me of the old Yahoo Pool game, I guess because of how simple it is to swing the putter. The maps are neat, and then there are community maps which adds to the playability. I like that there are some secret shots you can find on some holes. Had no issues playing with like 7 friends.

This probably isn't the kind of game you expect to have sentimental significance to people, but it does for me, so I'm going to get that out of the way and then focus on the more objective stuff.

So I was in an abusive relationship throughout 2021-2022. I won't get into the details, but it was pretty extreme, and included controlling who I could speak to/the friendships I could have, for how long I could be with them, and so on. I was very trauma-bonded to this person - I could not see how bad it was. I knew I was miserable, I knew it was abusive, but I was making excuses and I couldn't bring myself to leave or even to stand up for myself.

I was finally 'allowed' to have a game night with my best friend for an hour, and on that game night we played Golf With Your Friends. It was the first time we'd played (though we'd both seen YouTubers play it before), and we started off with the Forest map - and it was the hardest I'd laughed since my relationship began. Tears in my eyes, hysterics, non-stop laughing. I later found out that my mother had been outside my bedroom door listening, because she hadn't heard me laugh in so long.

That was one of the first steps in realising I had to get out, and the best friend I played with that night is now my fiancee.
Less heavily, this has been the background game for so many good conversations with my friend groups. It's always so much fun - often people will be reluctant to try it because, well, 'Golf With Your Friends' doesn't sound like a very appealing and exciting game on the surface to most of them, but once we're in it everyone is yelling and laughing and asking me when we can play it again.

The official courses are pretty good and have a decent amount of variety, but once you're done with them the real fun is in the custom/Steam Workshop courses. Sort by popular/most liked, check the comments to make sure there are no glitches that might prevent you from finishing, and go wild. There are some genuinely creative gems in there.

I've played other golf games, and this one has my favourite controls and general graphics. They're pretty smooth and easy to get accustomed to in my experience, and I very rarely, if ever, got frustrated with the game for making me fuck up as a result of a glitch or bad gameplay - any errors I make are entirely my own.

The customisation is cool - loved the cosmetics you can unlock for finishing courses, and my ball is now rolling around with a halo and angel wings. I also enjoy my little swan-boat float.
Really fun to play with multiple people online and it's pretty cool that you can download custom courses that other players have made!

Golf With Your Friends teeters on the edge with a 5/10 rating, offering a mix of simplicity and frustration. Its straightforward gameplay provides an easy entry point, but the game's simplicity can feel limiting and lacks depth for seasoned gamers. The frustration comes from unpredictable physics and occasional glitches that can lead to unexpected outcomes, testing players' patience. Despite these drawbacks, there's an odd charm in its simplicity, creating moments of genuine fun, especially in a lighthearted social setting. While it won't provide a deeply engaging golfing experience, it manages to deliver occasional enjoyable moments, making it a casual, albeit imperfect, multiplayer diversion.

I first played this game on the Xbox in 2020, and my frustration with it hasn't changed since then! Sure, some of the holes in this game are straight bullshit that give me the burning hatred to smash my keyboard into a million pieces, but I'd be damned if that wasn't the same reason for my enjoyment with this game! 

This game is best played with friends, so invite friends to play and get a party going as you'll cry, laugh, and argue with your friends as you all play through hours of courses trying to one-up each other for bragging rights. Add collision to the equation and witness aggression levels increase as you bump others away from their perfect shot. And even after you've played through all the base game courses, you can visit the workshop and browse hundreds of user created courses that'll ensure the fun never ends!

Whether it's becoming overjoyed from hitting a hole in one, the sigh of relief after conquering a hole after 12 frustrating strokes, or laughing at your friends terrible shot, this game will have you displaying every emotion know to man!

This game has been a great way to just relax and hang out with friends for a long time, and yes of course.. over time the game can get stale once everyone memorizes the maps so new content is always welcome. But at some point, the developers of this game decided to aggressively monetize new content. The game is called "Golf with your friends." But anyone who has online gaming friends can attest to this: NOT EVERYONE CAN AFFORD TO BUY DLC ALL THE TIME. So out of 4 friends, maybe only one or two are willing to buy new content. On top of that, this game is a glorified minigame. Why do new courses cost SO MUCH? Monetize the cosmetics, not the gameplay. I cannot recommend this game until maps are free.

Golf With Your Friends Is A Really Cool And Simple Golf Game To Play With Friends!
There's A Wide Selection Of Maps To Chose From To Play On Made By Team17, But There Are Maps Created By Other Players Which You Can Play Too.
On Golf You Can Play Either Solo, With Friends Or On Public Online Servers And You Can Add Mutators Which Add Little Fun Bonuses To The Game Like Low Gravity, Allow Jumping, No Collision With Other Players, Different Ball Shape etc.
There Are Different Game Modes Too Like Basketball Where You Have To Jump Into A Hoop As A Bouncy Basketball Or The Game mode Hockey Where You Have To Get a Hockey Puck Past A Goalkeeper And Into The Goal.
You Can Also Customise Your Ball Too With Hats, Different Colors, Trails And More.
I'd Recommend This Game As Its Simple And Enjoyable With Plenty To Do For Such A Game, With Friends Or Even By Yourself.

[h1] Overview / TLDR [/h1]
For this review I am going to split it into two segments. One being for the casual player that does not care for achievements, and the other being for achievement hunters and for those who enjoy trying to 100% games. TLDR: I do recommend this game for casual players and for those that want a fun game to play with friends but I [b] DO NOT [/b] recommend for achievement hunters at all.


[h2] Breakdown For Casual Players [/h2]
Generally speaking, this game is a great game to play either alone or with friends. There is a large variety of maps to choose from without spending any money on downloadable content and each time you play you can expect a fun and interactive shared experience. Some of the maps are hard to master and some are a lot easier. Of course if you need a guide, there are plenty of guides available through steam. I will leave a link to my personal favourite guide below.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2167218162] Golf With Friends Hole In One / Par Guide [/url]

Breaking this down a little further, the game has a unique soundtrack for each course that you play and there are a range of unique aspects such as gravity changes, ghost walls and more. These all add for a unique and fun experience when compared to other more simplistic crazy golf games.

The only issue in this game I have found so far is how your ball can glitch or phase through walls and getting stuck when shot at a high power. This is EXTREMELY frustrating, especially when near the end of a course and you are in PAR, forcing you to forfeit a shot because you cannot physically move the ball resulting in a maximum of 14 points. On certain maps this can happen 8-9 times out of 10 and it gets very annoying very quickly. Probably the only downside to this game but I must say it is quite a big one at that.

Overall, I would highly recommend this game for anyone looking for something fun to do with friends and wants a good laugh. It is somewhat fun to play alone but it is a lot better with friends, but then I guess that is obvious as it is in the name of the game.


[h2] Breakdown For Achievement Hunters [/h2]
So, you like collecting achievements huh? Well this game is going to drive you up the wall if that is the case.
Most games that have achievements have all of the base achievements unlocked when you first buy the game and if they have downloadable content achievements then they will normally all be unlocked through a one-time paid DLC that receives regular updates. Is this the case for Golf With Your Friends? NO of course not.

Golf With Your Friends has an insane amount of DLC courses which normally would not be an issue. You choose the ones that you like the most, buy them and get on with your day. However, ALL of these DLC course packs come with multiple achievements. This means that when they release a new (and expensive) course pack, you are forced to buy it if you want to keep this title in your list of games that you have perfected. If the courses were maybe £1.99 each or something then maybe it would not be as bad, but their most recent course costs a whopping £7.99. Now this may not seem like a big deal but when you compare it to the game's cost of £10.99, this is an ABSURD price tag for a single course with only 18 holes. And if you were to buy all of the course DLC packs, you would be paying OVER the original cost of the game at a total of £12.00.


[h1] Review Conclusion [/h1]
To conclude, I want to say that I do indeed recommend this game but only for casual players. If you are an achievement hunter there are many thousands of other games that you could spend time on and not have to pay an absurd amount every couple of months to keep the game perfected. Of course, if spending money is not an issue for you, then I would recommend it to you anyway. But honestly, I would not support the developers of this game with buying the DLC. They are just greedy and only care about the money that they make from the game.
It's Golf with your Friends. Not much more to be said.
a looot of fuuun

At first my friend and I had a lot of fun playing this and inviting others to join in some shenanigans - not even for good scores, just to mess around and do weird shots to see if we can make a new fun shortcut. The game works pretty fine from what we experienced, the odd lag/glitch here and there, sometimes our balls got stuck though we chalked that up to us getting it in unconventional areas. Then the new courses started to release as DLC where only one person needed to pay for others to play as well, and again we didn't mind *too* much because we were getting decent value for a half hour maybe of fun with each course pack of DLC. The problem is when the company announced price hikes for the previous DLC, and then priced their (at the time of this review) newest DLC for nearly $12CAD - WAY too much for a single DLC compared to the game's base price (about $17.50CAD). They've slowly started losing touch with their community and there isn't enough drive to want to support them if they're banking on those few folks who shell out for it/the achievements. It's a shame because it really was a lighthearted and upbeat game, but it isn't a *long* game you go back to very often and definitely not worth the inflated prices. Ultimately if you get this game on sale super cheap you'll find good value - or if they do a free weekend and you wanna dink around with friends. But I wouldn't recommend paying full price for the game, and ESPECIALLY not the DLC.

This review has been up in the air with me for a while. When I got the game, it was being developed solely by the original developer, Blacklight Interactive. $14.99 for fun with friends, absolutely. I have certainly gotten my money's worth. Is it still buggy and issues that have been long known of gone unfixed, yes. So if you were to just pick up the base game, you're good, even with unfixed bugs. Between the base courses and workshop courses, you have plenty of gameplay to get your money's worth, especially with friends. 

Now, the topic of DLC. It wasn't worth the price when it came out and now with Team17 being even more involved, they recently announced a hike in the price of DLC content, new AND old. They are increasing the price of the mediocre OLD DLC by 300% as well as new DLC coming out 2-3 times the price they used to release courses and cosmetics at. 

Avoid the DLC at all costs and just download courses from the workshop. They are more fun than any of the DLC courses, and many are much more refined. 

It pains me to see Team17 making so many decisions that clearly are not going to be well received from the player base. I understand inflation, I understand increased costs, I understand wanting to profit. However, releasing mediocre at best with super inflated prices is not how you do that. If they ever do anything to monetize the workshop, I will change my review to a negative one.

Also, the night of the review writing, my friends and I were plagued with network disconnect errors, so hopefully this isn't going to become a regular issue.

I really love this game, and I would actually recommend it, but I'm leaving a negative review because of the pricing/approach to DLC by the developers.

I don't know how people that aren't me or my friends play this game, but I feel that the strength of this game is easily its editor and the community levels. I play the community levels far, *far* more than the official levels, so seeing that a new DLC pack is effectively $9 for a course I will play for 30 minutes tops is discouraging. More than anything, I look forward to a DLC map release for new assets to use in the editor, but I can't in good conscience buy them just for the assets when it feels like an afterthought by the developers (they're often disorganized and clearly only the assets required for the official map, with no cohesion among the different asset packs).

I would love if the developers played more into to the clear strengths of this game (being the editor + community levels), maybe even making a DLC pack focused solely on purposeful and polished editor assets/features. I definitely recommend getting the base game and playing community levels with your friends, but the recent DLC pricing schemes feel out of touch to the playerbase.

A really fun and relaxing mini-golf game to play with your friends.  Highly recommended.

15 official 18-hole courses in various themes:
Forest
Haunted
Oasis
Space Station
Museum
Pirate Cove
Volcano
Ancient
Twilight
Candyland
Worms
The Escapists
The Deep
Bouncy Castle
Peaceful Pines

1 official 9-hole course:
Corrupted Forest

And there are many more player-made courses that you can subscribe to in the Workshop.

5 different modes:
Classic (normal), 
Hockey (playing with an ice-hockey puck),
Dunk (basket ball style),
Explore,
Party (featuring Snap Freeze, Honey Trap, Double Jump and Randomizer to change the shape of opponents' balls).
Or create and custom save your own modes.

Ball colour can be customised.  Hats, Trails and Floaties for your ball can be obtained through item drops by simply playing the game.
The controls are very simple. Settings include features like Maximum Shots and Time per round, Ball Spin, enable/disable Jump, Collision, Powerups, Gravity, Bouncy Ground, Ball Shape and Size.
Level Editor included to create your own courses.

This can easily keep you busy for many hours at a time.  Very addictive.

The game itself still has bugs and glitches with no fixes or patches. It needs a major overhaul and quality of life improvements considering the fact that some of the problems have been well-known since it phased out of Early Access.

The community is dead or dying. Most of the lobbies are protected by a password and the "Quick Play" option takes forever to find someone. You can be randomly disconnected from the server at any time, even when you play the game offline in solo mode. Obviously there's something wrong there. So do yourself a favor and invest in a better game.

Game used to be great. I've been playing since early access, but somewhere down the line they stopped maintaining the game and quit improving the experience, and we're left with a stale game still riddled with bugs. 

The physics never got the jank ironed out; crappy collision on various courses is still the same it was years ago; the rare times they release updates, player's custom maps get broken; custom maps have a huge range of issues, thanks to weak map building tools. Basically it plays like it's in early access still, which is just sad at this point. You really should have taken more pride in your work and continued to improve it. 

I didn't follow the behind the scenes much, but at some point the game sold to Team17 I think? Knowing what I do about them from other games I have zero faith in this game improving. 

There's also talks that Team17 slipped in monitoring software without telling anyone, but those threads keep getting removed from the forums. Will they flag this review for noting this? Who can say! I think I've had my fill of this game remaining as stagnant as it has, and I don't trust the devs.

Gameplay:

Golf With Your Friends is a multiplayer golf game that is easy to learn but difficult to master. The gameplay is simple: you use your mouse or controller to aim and shoot the ball, and try to get it into the hole in as few strokes as possible. However, there are a lot of different factors to consider, such as the wind, the terrain, and the obstacles. This makes the game challenging and rewarding, and it's always satisfying to make a great shot.

Music:

The music in Golf With Your Friends is upbeat and fun, and it really sets the mood for the game. The soundtrack is composed by Michael Wyckoff, and it features a variety of different genres, including electronic, rock, and pop. The music is always changing to match the action on the course, and it really helps to keep the game feeling fresh.

Soundtrack:

The sound effects in Golf With Your Friends are also great. The sound of the ball hitting the ground, the club hitting the ball, and the crowd cheering are all very satisfying. The sound effects also help to create a sense of immersion, and they really make you feel like you're playing a real game of golf.

Courses:

Golf With Your Friends features a variety of different courses, each with its own unique challenges. There are courses set in forests, deserts, cities, and even on the moon. There are also courses that are themed after popular games, such as Mario Kart and Sonic the Hedgehog. The courses are all well-designed and challenging, and they provide a lot of variety to the game.

Unlockables:

Golf With Your Friends features a variety of unlockables, such as new courses, balls, and hats. You can unlock these by playing the game, completing challenges, or winning tournaments. The unlockables are a great way to keep the game feeling fresh, and they give you something to work towards.

Overall, Golf With Your Friends is an excellent multiplayer golf game that is sure to provide hours of fun. The gameplay is simple but challenging, the music is great, the sound effects are satisfying, the courses are varied and challenging, and there are a lot of unlockables to keep you coming back for more. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys golf or multiplayer games.

Here are some additional things I love about Golf With Your Friends:

* The couch co-op mode is a lot of fun, and it's a great way to bond with friends and family.
* The online multiplayer is also great, and it's a lot of fun to compete against other players from all over the world.
* The game is constantly being updated with new content, so there's always something new to play.
* The developers are very active and responsive to feedback, which is great to see.

If you're looking for a fun and challenging multiplayer golf game, then Golf With Your Friends is definitely worth checking out.

The latest maps are overpriced for what you get, and they are planning to increase the prices further. If you already bought it, it's a good game. If you're looking to purchase this, I'd suggest staying away and finding a better golf game that doesn't nickel and dime their players.

Devs increasing the price of year old DLC by 2x-3x, not a fan of that

The game itself is decently fun but nothing special.

But as of today, Team17 decided it would be a great idea to raise the price of all existing DLC's.
Personally I didn't feel like the DLC's were worth the money before when community maps you got for free were at least as good if not better.
Now they most certainly are not.
Who thought that raising the price of a year old DLC from 3€ to 9€ would be acceptable?

TL/DR: Game can be fun but avoid because of publisher greed. Choose any other golf game such as Golf IT or Golf Around instead!

Golf With Your Friends is an absolute delight that brings a fresh and exciting twist to the world of casual multiplayer gaming. This charming and addictive game combines the timeless appeal of mini-golf with a playful multiplayer experience, resulting in an absolute must-play for friends and family looking to share laughter-filled moments together.

From the first swing, Golf With Your Friends captures the essence of fun and friendly competition. The game offers a range of creatively designed courses, each with its own set of imaginative obstacles and challenges. These courses are not only visually appealing but also offer a perfect blend of skill and chance, ensuring that players of all ages and skill levels can enjoy themselves without feeling overwhelmed. The variety of themes, from fantastical landscapes to quirky urban setups, keeps the game fresh and engaging.

The multiplayer aspect of Golf With Your Friends is where the game truly shines. The ability to play with friends online or locally fosters an atmosphere of camaraderie and laughter. It's an experience that transcends traditional competitive gaming, as you share hilarious moments and epic comebacks with your friends, creating unforgettable memories in the process. The intuitive controls and straightforward mechanics make it easy for everyone to jump in and have a blast, regardless of their gaming background.

One of the standout features of Golf With Your Friends is its customization options. The game allows you to personalize your golf ball and even experiment with various power-ups that can either aid your progress or create hilarious chaos. This adds an extra layer of strategy and unpredictability, making each round unique and unpredictable. It's these moments of friendly chaos that make the game truly special, as you navigate unexpected twists and turns alongside your pals.

The graphics and sound design of Golf With Your Friends complement the lighthearted nature of the gameplay perfectly. The vibrant and colorful visuals enhance the whimsical atmosphere of the game, while the catchy soundtrack and amusing sound effects contribute to the overall charm. The seamless blend of audio and visuals ensures an immersive experience that draws you in and keeps you engaged for hours on end.

Golf With Your Friends is more than just a game; it's a bonding experience that brings people together for hours of shared amusement. It's the perfect recipe for a memorable game night or a relaxing weekend with friends, where laughter is the main course and unforgettable moments are par for the course. Whether you're an experienced gamer or someone looking for a casual and enjoyable multiplayer experience, Golf With Your Friends is a hole-in-one that will keep you coming back for more.

[h1]Golf with Your Friends - A Whimsical Hole-in-One for Endless Fun[/h1]

In the realm of multiplayer gaming, few titles manage to capture the essence of lighthearted camaraderie and simple, yet addictive gameplay quite like Golf with Your Friends. This delightful mini-golf experience is a charming blend of competitive golf mechanics and zany obstacle courses, providing players of all skill levels with a refreshing and accessible multiplayer experience that's as enjoyable as it is engaging.

From the moment you tee off in Golf with Your Friends, it's clear that the game's primary objective is to deliver a good time in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. The cartoonish visuals and whimsical art style set the tone for the gameplay, creating a lighthearted ambiance that encourages laughter and friendly competition among players. Whether you're putting through a pirate-themed course complete with swinging anchors and treacherous waters or navigating a candy-filled wonderland with sugary ramps and chocolate obstacles, each course is a creative masterpiece that never fails to bring a smile to your face.

At the core of Golf with Your Friends lies a deceptively simple golfing mechanic that's easy to pick up but offers surprising depth. The intuitive controls make aiming and putting a breeze, allowing players to focus on strategy and finesse. The game strikes a balance between accessibility and challenge, making it equally appealing to players who are new to mini-golf and those who are seasoned pros. Each hole presents its own unique set of obstacles and challenges, from tricky jumps to winding tunnels, ensuring that no two shots are the same and providing a satisfying sense of accomplishment with each successful putt.

While the solo experience is engaging, Golf with Your Friends truly shines when played with a group of friends or online competitors. The game supports multiplayer with up to 12 players, creating a chaotic yet hilarious environment where the friendly banter and playful rivalry add an extra layer of enjoyment. The ability to spectate other players' shots and witness their triumphs and near-misses adds a social element that keeps everyone engaged, even when it's not their turn. The moments of shared laughter and groans as players attempt to navigate tricky obstacles and score the elusive hole-in-one create a sense of camaraderie that is at the heart of Golf with Your Friends' charm.

Customization and variety are integral to the game's appeal, and Golf with Your Friends offers an impressive array of options to keep players entertained. The game features a multitude of themed courses, each with its own distinct challenges and settings. From ancient Egyptian ruins to outer space escapades, the diverse range of courses ensures that players never run out of unique and imaginative holes to explore. Additionally, the game offers a selection of creative power-ups that can turn the tide of a match, adding an element of surprise and strategy to the gameplay. The ability to customize your golf ball with unique skins and effects further adds a personal touch and showcases the game's attention to detail.

Golf with Your Friends' presentation and performance also deserve applause. The game runs smoothly and maintains a consistent frame rate, even with a full lobby of players. The whimsical sound effects and cheerful music contribute to the game's overall charm, creating an audiovisual experience that complements the gameplay perfectly. The intuitive menu design and user-friendly interface ensure that players can jump into a match quickly and easily, making it an ideal choice for both casual gaming sessions and longer play sessions with friends.

In conclusion, Golf with Your Friends is a delightful multiplayer gem that captures the essence of lighthearted fun and camaraderie. Its accessible mechanics, imaginative courses, and emphasis on multiplayer interaction create an engaging experience that's perfect for both casual gamers and competitive groups alike. Whether you're sharing laughs and victories with friends or challenging yourself to achieve that perfect putt, Golf with Your Friends is a hole-in-one when it comes to delivering a charming and addictive multiplayer experience. So gather your buddies, choose your favorite ball skin, and get ready for a rollicking good time as you embark on a mini-golf adventure that's bound to keep you smiling from start to finish.

Having desired to get into a proper putting golf type of game for a while now, Golf With Your Friends by the famed studio Team 17 (beloved creators of the Worms series alongside the more recent Escapist games) is exactly the kind of game that excels at giving players a fun and relaxing experience going through 18 holes of varied challenges, some simple and straightforward whilst others are difficult and tricky to navigate, in what is currently boasting an impressive 13 courses consisting of various colourful environments full of personality with an additional 2 courses unlockable as DLC. (More on this later)

To start off though, focusing on the gameplay here, Golf With Your Friend aims to deliver a simple yet highly satisfying golf putter experience as the goal is to aim your ball and hit it in putter style (seeing how this isn't *quite* actual golf, which one could make the case of being a more skillful, albeit less relaxing sport to kick back and relax to) to achieve par on each of the eighteen holes, with the optimal objective being to gain as 'low' a score as possible by means of securing birdies, eagles and the occasional hole in one and albatross (essentially golf lingo for how much fewer shots it took for you to get the ball in the hole than was expected) for both bragging reasons as well as getting those 'cheevos' as it were!

Noting how this is quite the golfing game full of personality, one of the things I quite like about it is how customizable it is, first and foremost being able to personalize your own golf ball to a surprisingly high degree, starting off with just colouring your ball to your favourite colour but can later be given various accessories that can be unlocked by playing matches online (up to 3 per day on a 24 hour basis) that can be either fancy hats to add on top of your golf ball, neat trails to give a sweet effect after you hit your ball, a charismatic float to add some extra personality to your ball in case it finds itself floating on the water and even entirely new skins for your golf ball should you be lucky enough to get one! 

And the other main part of customization that truly makes Golf With Your Friends a standout experience  is how, alongside the 13 regular courses and 2 DLC ones made by the developers that you can play, one can make their very own courses by means of a pretty-decent level editor that gives them access to an entire world of their own to slowly craft and build their own 18 holes, albeit it is fairly flexible in that it can be as small as just the one in an incredibly highly-detailed or gargantuan-sized area for the one singular hole to take place in if that's what you desire, so much can be explored with just the level editor alone as it were!

Although to touch upon the gameplay itself directly, the physics is handled fairly well as what separates a good golfer from an amateur here is carefully angling your shots and powering them just right to ensure that you can not only skip corners that newer, more inexperienced players won't want to risk messing up but also potentially allowing you to take massive shortcuts if you take daring shots by bouncing it off not just the course itself but it's many background objects to ensure you stay ahead of the competition as it were, rewarding skilled gameplay without necessarily restricting it but also ensuring it's not too easy to pull off either!

All in all, Golf With Your Friends is quite the enjoyable golf putting game all things considered, however it does still share some faults that I would like to highlight here in this review.

First and most pressing is the questionable practice of the DLC here, seeing as it is one thing to put a paywall behind many fancy cosmetics (although this practice itself can be problematic depending on how it's done, such as lootboxes hiding being abnormally rare probabilities for the most desirable cosmetics and battle passes demanding insanely long grinds to reach those cosmetics coupled with convenient 'battle pass skips' as a way of bypassing the whole grind) so to restrict entire courses and their objects for use in the level editor is one thing, however it can be intrusive when achievements themselves are also locked behind the DLC itself, meaning one has to pay up for to access the full gameplay content as well as 100%'ing a game so to speak!

Note that, although I don't personally take issue with preferring to lock content in gameplay over locking cosmetics as there is plenty enough as is alongside almost all of the cosmetics being earnable, it is a strange and bizarre choice to lock achievements behind the DLC as most companies offering DLC make them either separate achievements or just don't bother with adding extra ones to begin with, however Team 17 made the active decision to link DLC achievements with the main game, so do with that as you will since the only counterargument is that the 2 DLC courses are only (as of writing of this review) £2.00 each roughly which, whilst fairly cheap and inconsequential, is a tad expensive when you compare it to the game's current price of £10.99 for 13 whole courses plus the level editor and most cosmetics not a part of the DLC packs.

Other issues with this game include the occasional weird physics issues where taking shots beyond a certain power level can lead to rare instances where your golf ball will seemingly either 'bounce' for no explainable reason and likely result in you going out of bounds (even when taking said shot on plain ground and not falling off down below!) or being reflected back and hit off at an angle alongside the general online activity not being nearly as active as it was back in Golf With Your Friend's earlier years going back to it's original release in 2020 as trying to find lobbies proved occasionally difficult and hosting a lobby for yourself can take some time before getting a lobby of more than two people here, which could prove frustrating in the long-term for those without the advantage of large circles of friends or for streamers with a decent following.

Still, despite the odd problem I had with the game here, I would still recommend Golf With Your Friends to those looking for a casual golfing experience filled with plenty of personality coupled with wacky courses set in various colourful settings oozing with their own unique charms as it is a pretty good game to either mess around in or take to a more competitive level for golfing professionals as it were!

TLDR Version:

• A wonderful golf putting game with 15 unique courses (two of which are DLC) each filled with 18 holes to challenge the player with increasing complexity (+)
• Golf With Your Friend has plenty of customization options where it allows you to add various accessories to your own golf ball alongside it's colour to make it stand out from the crowd (+)
• Impressive Level Editor that adds even more long-term gameplay for those who wish to express a creative vision of their own onto the game that can be shared with others (+)
• The gameplay is fair enough in difficulty that casuals won't feel ostracized trying to play well despite lack of experience whilst design of courses allows for more competitive players to enjoy more serious matches (+)
• Fairly satisfying physics as mastery of how to best angle each shot alongside matching the power level to the distance of each putt is what separates pros from amateurs (+)

• Questionable DLC practices by the development team that lock whole courses alongside some cosmetics behind paid DLC alongside achievements that aren't made separate from the main game (-)
• Some occasional physics problems occur where putting has a rare chance of resulting in bizarre bouncing or reflections of the golf ball which almost always results in it going out-of-bounds (-)
• Golf With Your Friends unfortunately is not as busy as it was back in 2020 which results in some difficulty in arranging lobbies for online matches depending on the time of day (-)

Golf is an online PvP deathmatch for up to 100 players, in which players airdrop from a "Battle Bus" that crosses the game's map and must scavenge for weapons while trying to stay alive and eliminate other players. Golf, unlike most ball games, is often used as a watertight, vertical cylinder or truncated cone with an open top and a flat bottom, attached to a semicircular carrying handle for the express purpose of transporting liquid substances (often water or estradiol valerate oil).

In American culture, Golf was a controversial subject until the mid to late 1600s for its socialist and humanitarian themes, in particular with members of the "Bagel" political party referring to it with the derogatory slang phrase "putt-putt". Golf regained popularity shortly following the second Coronavirus pandemic within the Martian BDSM community as a form of meditation.

Introduction:
Golf With Your Friends is a delightful multiplayer golfing experience that combines the beloved sport of golf with a fun and competitive twist. Developed by Blacklight Interactive, this game brings together friends and family for a wild and wacky golfing adventure. With its charming visuals, inventive courses, and addictive gameplay, Golf With Your Friends offers a hole-in-one experience that will keep players hooked for hours on end.

Captivating Gameplay:
Golf With Your Friends takes the simple and enjoyable game of golf and transforms it into a riotous multiplayer experience. The game allows up to 12 players to compete in various game modes, including classic mini-golf, hockey, and basketball-inspired challenges. Each mode offers a unique twist on the traditional golfing mechanics, providing a fresh and exciting experience every time you tee off.

Endless Course Variety:
One of the standout features of Golf With Your Friends is its impressive array of imaginative and meticulously designed courses. Players can embark on a journey through 11 stunning environments, ranging from tranquil medieval castles to vibrant candy-filled landscapes. The attention to detail in each course is astonishing, with intricate obstacles, hidden shortcuts, and breathtaking scenery that adds to the overall charm of the game.

Competitive and Cooperative Fun:
Whether you're in the mood for friendly competition or cooperative gameplay, Golf With Your Friends caters to all preferences. Engage in intense multiplayer battles as you strive to outwit and outscore your opponents, or join forces with friends to conquer challenging obstacles together. The game strikes an excellent balance between casual and competitive play, making it accessible to players of all skill levels.

Satisfying Progression System:
As you conquer courses and earn achievements, Golf With Your Friends rewards you with unlockable hats and skins that add a touch of personalization to your golfing adventures. Customizing your golf ball and character with quirky accessories enhances the overall experience and provides an added incentive to keep playing and exploring new courses.

Seamless Online Multiplayer:
The online multiplayer component of Golf With Your Friends is a standout feature. Whether you're playing with friends or joining public matches, the game seamlessly connects players from around the world. The matchmaking system ensures you'll always find opponents or teammates to play with, creating a vibrant and engaging community.

Visuals and Audio:
Golf With Your Friends boasts delightful and colorful visuals that perfectly complement its lighthearted gameplay. From the vibrant landscapes to the creative course designs, every element is visually pleasing and exudes a sense of fun and playfulness. The cheerful soundtrack adds to the overall ambiance, keeping you entertained and engaged throughout your golfing adventures.

Conclusion:
Golf With Your Friends is a must-play game that captures the essence of multiplayer fun and brings it to the world of golf. Its combination of imaginative courses, addictive gameplay, and seamless online multiplayer make it a standout title for both casual and competitive players. Whether you're looking for a way to bond with friends or seeking an entertaining solo experience, Golf With Your Friends will undoubtedly provide hours of enjoyment. So grab your putter, gather your friends, and get ready for an unforgettable golfing journey that will keep you coming back for more.

(Please do not take my hours played as an endorsement. My friends enjoy this game more than I do, and I don't hate it [i]quite[/i] enough to refuse to play. Yet.)

GWYF is very glitchy and unreliable in incredibly frustrating ways. Here is an [u]incomplete[/u] list of some of the glitches that offend me the most:

-Your ball will inconsistently jump when you press jump. Very. Inconsistently. 

-Ball X is behind ball Y, ball Y goes off and gets in the hole. When ball X shoots, it mysteriously bounces off in a random direction, as if it bounced off ball Y, even though ball Y has been gone for three minutes. 

-On some courses, your ball can leave the course but jump back onto the green and everything's fine. Others, if you touch out of bounds for a moment, even if you get back to the green, you will be reset. There's no rhyme or reason for how a hole will act.

-There was a year when you were never awarded a hat for playing any multiplayer games. It took them nearly a [b]year[/b] to get it fixed.

-Sometimes, your ball lands somewhere that is clearly supposed to be out of bounds, but it's legal. Far worse, sometimes your ball lands somewhere that is clearly supposed to be legal, but you get reset as if you were out of bounds. Some of these spots are consistent, some are not.

-The newest glitch my friends and I have dubbed 'The Invisible Hand Of Gingy.' Sometimes your ball just... bounces away. You've shot a reasonable shot, it's flying through open air, no obstacles anywhere nearby, and then suddenly BOING you're going in a completely different direction for no reason at all. It's as if the invisible hand of gingy has struck you down and said 'NO.' We've been playing this game for years now and have only developed this term recently, meaning in the past few months, someone changed a line of code and it went poorly. 

-Plus many less infuriating glitches: your ball is suddenly under the green instead of on top of it; your ball stops on a moving platform and you're trapped because the game doesn't think you've come to a stop; the camera angle rubberbands if your ball is too close to a wall; etc. ad nauseum. 

Do not spend money on this game if you want a game that's even vaguely well programmed.

Game is worth picking up on sale, but the DLC is hit or miss.

This is possibly one of my most favourite games to play with a group. Our group used to get together nightly for a few weeks and now just make a habit of hopping on occasionally to play together in this game. It's great to mess with your friends, add additional difficulty by changing the physics or shapes of the balls, cheer your friends on making a difficult shot, and mock their failure to get in the hole (it happens more than you think). If I'm being honest, some of the user-created holes are even better than the ones released from the developers just for the sheer absurdity and difficulty of the holes (looking at you, Dark Souls maps).

Also, fun hats for your balls.

Never written a review before but this game has been living rent free in my head for months.
I DO NOT recommend buying this trash.
Yeah, it starts out fun because you buy it to play with some friends, you hop onto the first map and it's a great time. But then you move on to the other default levels and everything starts unraveling. The map design is dreadful, you bounce of off invisible obstacles because elements on the course don't line up properly (IN A MAP THAT IS IN THE GAME BY DEFAULT) which makes me pity the community map makers (if the devs can't get it right I imagine it must be tough for them). 
Out of the group I played with I started to get skeptical first, but it only took until the Worms themed course for everyone to realize that buying this game was a mistake.
I'm guessing there might be some good stuff lurking on the workshop, but searching by most popular just returned a bunch of the most bog standard stuff imaginable.

I'm genuinely annoyed at myself that I let myself go over the refund playtime limit with this one.

Love playing this game with friends. Unlike the title though they don't have to be your friends, just as long as you don't mind being awkward and injecting yourself into other people's lives.

This isn't your ordinary session of minigolf. Golf With Your Friends consists of numerous maps with special conditions and items that can be used. There's gravity wells, black holes, jet packs, and cannons, just to name a few. Fully customize the conditions of your game from the amount of holes to the shape of your ball. You even earn little fancy customizations the longer you play.

I've always been curious about this game from watching several YouTubers play it. Eventually it went on sale for $5 and I was able to convince about four of my friends to get it. We usually only play over the weekend but it is pretty fun. I don't even mind losing, which I do most of the time.

There are some frustrating bugs and other elements to the game. During the Worms course, I fell through the world multiple times. Expect to waste a stroke frequently because either the flagpole will bounce your ball away from the hole, or the hole will slide you over instead of right into it. There's also this frustrating lack of direction on some holes. The game has very elaborate shots and when it isn't clear where to go, you can run out of strokes fast.

I've been through all of the default game courses (excluding the DLC ones) and I definitely have my favorites. Steer clear of Worms and Twilight if you don't want to yeet your computer out the nearest window. A map editing mode makes for endless possibilities but so far, the workshop doesn't seem that full of too many options.

The game is three years old and still has some kinks that need to be worked out. I recommend getting it on sale, but either way, it can be a pretty fun time, especially if you have friends and voice chat.

Golf with Friends is a fun and lighthearted mini-golf game that is perfect for playing with friends. The game's whimsical and colorful design, coupled with its simple controls, make it easy to pick up and play for players of all skill levels.

One of the best features of Golf with Friends is its multiplayer mode. Playing with friends is an absolute blast, and the game's various courses offer a lot of fun and challenging obstacles to overcome. It's great to see everyone's different play styles and strategies come into play, and the competitive nature of the game can lead to some truly hilarious moments.

However, there are some downsides to Golf with Friends. For one, the game's physics engine can be frustratingly unpredictable at times, making it difficult to gauge the power and trajectory of your shots. This can lead to some frustrating moments where your ball bounces around in ways that don't make sense or don't feel fair.

"Oh, what a fun mini golf game to play with friends. This looks like something fun to play and in no way will this put me in a bad mood"
You are dead fucking wrong.
At first glance you think it is a cute game. Which it is. At the first course. But then the last hole in the Forest course is just a preview of what is to come. 
You think you know what pain is, you son of a bitch? I'll show you pain. Just imagine just having your balls glitch and miss obvious shots. When your friends are racing to get that perfect par while fighting against the clock. Imagine your ball getting lost in the water and you have to keep bobbing your ball to hopefully get it on the green. I have seen grown hardened men break down emotionally, spiritually, physically, and mentally over this game.  I have seen lifelong friendships get decimated over the course of this game. This game will challenge you and your friendships like no other. If you are ready for a challenge, I implore you to play golf with friends.

Really not a fan of the physics in this game, makes it really not fun when you're playing in a group and you and one other person just get tossed around while everyone else makes it in a few hits. There's a lot of times where you'll clearly hit the ball in, but it loop-de-loops around the hole and spins you out, or you land in the hole and bounce back out and land right at the edge. Achievements are buggy too, I played a full round on Oasis on casual for the achievement, and didn't get it. Few other ones I didn't get either. I don't have many friends who like to play this game, and the groups that I have played it with we always moved onto something else because we kept getting screwed over.
Update: my friend and I have been achievement hunting and i spent the last hour trying to do the par achievements. I got screwed over cause I hit tab to open the stroke menu instead of the escape menu so it didn't pause the timer so I got a penalty and had to completely restart at hole 14. Turned off the timer and redid it and got 13 under par but no achievement so looks like the scummy devs strike again, they made it so you can't even adjust the timer at all or you don't get the achievement and don't warn you about it. Absolute trash devs.

Are you ready to tee off for some mini-golf madness? Look no further than Golf With Your Friends, the wacky and chaotic game that's perfect for playing with your pals.

Now, I'm no Tiger Woods, but I do know a good game when I see one. Golf With Your Friends is a hilarious take on the classic game of mini-golf, with colorful and creative player-made courses that will have you laughing and crying at the same time.

But be warned, this game can be frustratingly fun. You'll find yourself bouncing around obstacles, flying off ramps, and trying to avoid those dreaded water hazards. It's like a game of real golf, but without the pretentious dress code or the green fees.

With the ability to play with up to 12 friends, Golf With Your Friends is perfect for those looking for a fun and casual multiplayer experience. Whether you're playing with your best buds or taking on strangers online, this game will have you putting for par in no time.

While the game does have its faults, such as occasional bugs and wonky physics, it's still a blast to play. Plus, with a constant stream of new player-made courses being added, the game has endless replayability.

Overall, Golf With Your Friends gets a score of 7.4 out of 10. It's not a perfect game, but it's definitely worth checking out if you're looking for a fun and silly multiplayer experience. So grab your putter, line up your shot, and get ready to scream "fore" as you play Golf With Your Friends!

I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 16 and friend-less. My son recently started Golf With Your Friends but he has no friends and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son lacking friends, as he is always out with his non-existent friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him because he has no friends. I loaded into the game, did the tutorial but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died because he has no friends. This game has ever since brought my son, who has no friends, and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son, still has no friends, many happy memories.

golf

Yyyyyyyessssssss... a very long, drawn-out, lazily drawled affirmation.  Yeah, maybe you should.  If, as the game says, you have friends.

I mean, lookit, it's a miniputt golf game.  Standard golf stuff: put the ball in the target hole in the fewest shots to win.  Unlike regular, boring-ass golf, the areas you're playing in are whimsical and require some tricky shots to pull off.  I like miniputt golf a heap.

By default, the vast majority of the courses are tricky, challenging, and punish bad shots.  Those default settings make it very difficult to get a meaningful overview of the course, and on top of that, there's a time limit, so the first few playthroughs of any course are going to involve some degree of bumbling and frustration.  So how you play it depends on your friends:

* Are your friends chill, casual, and enjoy a laugh at their own expense?  Default settings are fine. But you can also dial a bunch of wacky settings into the game too--cubes for balls, hyper-bounciness, spontaneous jumping, etc.

* Are your friends a bunch of hyper-competitive blowhards?  Default settings, and practice, practice, and more practice.  With experience in the game and the courses, you'll get a better feel for how everything comes together and find various trick-shots to shortcut through the game.

* Somehwere in between?  There's bizarre other modes, such as "dunk" or "hockey" that do I-don't-know-precisely-what.  It may be worth investigating.  Especially if your buddies are given over to laughing rather than frustrated cussing.

Since the game also lets you dress up your golfballs with various wacky skins and gewgaws, the game does kind of lend itself more to a wackier set of people.  It's also awfully competitive!  I don't know!

Anyway, I had a few rousingly fun matches with friends, but I am going to dial in a few more casual and factors into the game next time we play.  If you have Friends you can Golf With that lean towards more absurd fun, you'll get your money's worth even at default pricing, in my arrogant opinion.

Having been a fan of Walkabout Mini Golf (VR) on Quest 2, I was looking for a good non-VR mini golf game.

Perhaps I've been spoilt by Walkabout, where the courses are imaginatively and beautifully designed, the mechanics are fun, and the graphics don't look a decade old.

But Golf with your Friends pales by comparison. Boring mechanics, poor graphics and the extra modes, particularly Dunk are just frustrating and not at all fun.

This is just about worth picking up in the sale for a few quid, but only just, if only to be reminded of how good a golf game can be (i.e. Walkabout).

"I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 16. My son recently started Dinkum and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, did the tutorial but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories."

Chill vibes with a lot of room to fine-tune the game to your preferences, enabling varying balances of "cheaty" or unrealistic options against more traditional and "serious" ones. At least, as serious as you can get when you're golfing through candyland and the like. The soundtrack also has a couple surprisingly good entries - the volcano BGM is a remarkable spacey ambient track. Multiplayer's easy to pull together too. At time of writing, it's been my top pick for multiplayer PC minigolf games for a good while. It's not exactly a rigorous simulation. Even with all the most realistic options, you still can't arc your shots vertically and the physics tend to be a bit floaty and low-friction. Probably not a good pick if you're a grognard for accurate simulation of the sport, but as a low-pressure party game it's perfectly robust.

Golf With Your Friends is a delightful and entertaining casual game that's perfect for playing with your buddies. With simple controls and a variety of fun and quirky maps to choose from, it's easy to jump right in and start having a blast.

What sets Golf With Your Friends apart from other golf games is the sheer variety of maps available, each with their own unique challenges and obstacles to overcome. From the giant candy land of Candyland to the perilous pirate cove of Buccaneer's Bay, each map is packed with creative and imaginative designs that will keep you entertained for hours.

But while Golf With Your Friends is certainly a fun and casual game, it can also be incredibly frustrating at times. Some of the maps are designed to be particularly challenging, with narrow gaps, tricky jumps, and other obstacles that require precise timing and skill to navigate. But it's precisely these challenges that make the game so enjoyable and rewarding to play with friends. Nothing beats the thrill of finally sinking that impossible shot after dozens of failed attempts.

Playing with friends is where Golf With Your Friends truly shines. The game supports up to 12 players at a time, making it perfect for hosting large multiplayer games with friends and family. The game also includes a range of fun customization options, allowing you to personalize your golf ball, trails, and other in-game elements to your liking.

Overall, Golf With Your Friends is a fun, engaging, and often frustrating casual game that's perfect for playing with friends. The varied maps, creative designs, and customization options all make for a delightful and entertaining experience that's sure to keep you coming back for more.
